fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Write \mathop {\textrm {Gal}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F})=\{\sigma _{1},…,\sigma _{r}\}, then \sigma _{i}\Bbbk / \mathbb {F} is a root extension, so each extension \mathbb {F}=K_{0}\subset K_{1}\subset …\subset K_{n}=\Bbbk we have for each \sigma _{j}\in \mathop {\textrm {Gal}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F}), \mathbb {F}=\sigma _{j}K_{0}\subset \sigma _{j}K_{1}\subset …\subset \sigma _{j}K_{n}=\sigma _{j}\Bbbk . If K_{i+1}=K_{i}(a_{i}^{1 / n_{i}}), then \sigma _{j}K_{i+1}\sigma _{j}K_{i}(\sigma _{j}a^{1 / n_{i}}). But since a_{i}^{1 / n_{i}} is a root of x^{n_{i}}-a_{i}, we see that \sigma _{j}a_{i}^{1 / n_{i}} is a root of x^{n_{i}}-\sigma _{j}a_{i}. So if \Bbbk / \mathbb {F} is a root extension, then so is \sigma _{j}\Bbbk / \mathbb {F}. Then applying Composite of root extensions is a root extension inductively, the composite of all \sigma _{j}\Bbbk (which is \mathbb {L}) is a root extension of \mathbb {F}.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Galois closure of a root extension is a root extension

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \Bbbk / \mathbb {F} be a Root Extension, let \mathbb {L} be a Galois closure of \Bbbk . Then \mathbb {L} / \mathbb {F} is a Root Extension.

Write \mathop {\textrm {Gal}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F})=\{\sigma _{1},…,\sigma _{r}\}, then \sigma _{i}\Bbbk / \mathbb {F} is a root extension, so each extension \mathbb {F}=K_{0}\subset K_{1}\subset …\subset K_{n}=\Bbbk we have for each \sigma _{j}\in \mathop {\textrm {Gal}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F}), \mathbb {F}=\sigma _{j}K_{0}\subset \sigma _{j}K_{1}\subset …\subset \sigma _{j}K_{n}=\sigma _{j}\Bbbk .
